intro: Philippia trimera subsp. elgonensis, commonly known as the Elgon mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa, particularly in the Mount Elgon area. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in montane grasslands and forest margins. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
